intro: Euphrasia philippii, commonly known as Philippi's eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Euphrasia philippii is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
